description: Initial primes of sets of 6 consecutive primes in arithmetic progression. Each set has a constant difference equal to 30. These are the smallest such sets.
comments: It is conjectured that there exist arbitrarily long sequences of consecutive primes in arithmetic progression. As of December 2000 the record is 10 primes.
links: Index entries for sequences related to primes in arithmetic progressions
formula: Found by exhaustive search for 6 primes that are in arithmetic progression with all other intermediate numbers being composite.
author: Harvey Dubner (harvey(AT)dubner.com), Dec 18 2000
